name: Estonia
takeaway: The Estonian media is largely free from PRC interference due to a fallout in 2020.
As an EU country, Estonia adheres to the EU's overall strategy to treat the PRC as a partner, competitor and rival simultaneously.

While academia is the most problematic area due to lack of China experts, domestic politics has been inproportionally influenced by the PRC when PRC-Estonian economic relations are taken into consideration.
It is alarming to see PRC's direct impacts on Estonian Technology and Military Domains, but it has limited influence on Society and Law Enforcement.
description-1: In 2023, Estonia had a GDP per capita of US$29,824 and a total population of 1.37 million people.
description-2: Estonia established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1991. Estonia was ranked 6th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 95/100.

Media.evidence: There is no identified media organisation that belongs to the World Chinese Media network
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified journalist or media organisation which are members of the Belt and Road Media Cooperation Alliance/Unio, the Belt and Road News Alliance, or other Belt and Road News Alliance, or other Belt and Road media networks tat connected to the PRC
Media.note: A list of members of Belt and Road Alliance
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified journalist, media organization or online influencer who have participated in international travel organized by PRC state-owned media or PRC-connected entities.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified journalist, media organization or online influencer who have received trainings from PRC state-owned media or PRC-connected entities.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Estonian cable service provider STV features CGTN-Russian. In Estonia, there are roughly 1/4 Russian-speaking population.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified local media outlet wholly or partly owned by PRC citizens or corporations.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The Youtube channel of the City of Tallinn has published a Chinese state-funded TV program on Chinese New Year Celebration. It's not dubbed in Estonian but there were Estonian subtitles embedded in the video.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified regular PRC state-media or government advertisements inserted within local newspapers, online news websites or social media.
Media.note: Major Estonian newsoutlets Potimees and Eesti Päevaleht have promised not to publish Chinese state-funded advertisement since 2021.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In 2019, Estonian newspaper published articles on Chinese influence in Estonia. The Chinese embassador to Estonia responded by saying that the job of a journalist is to support good relations between countries.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In 2023, the Estonian government signed a Media Freedom Coalition Statement to express concerns on Hong Kong and Chinese authorities' attacks on press freedom in Hong Kong.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no identified media personality (including reporters, journalists or commentators) or celebrity who deny the existence of human rights abuses in the PRC (e.g. a media personality that doubts there are re-education camps for Uyghurs in Xinjiang).
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Estonian parliament Riigikogu has an Estonia-China parliamentary group for official meetings between Estonian parliamentarians and Chinese parliamentarians.
Foreign Policy.note: https://www.mfa.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/oz_678770/1206_678820/1206x2_678840/200409/t20040924_9329739.shtml | China-Estonia Friendship Group established by the Chinese National People's Congress
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Estonia is very unlikely to have recived foreign aid from the PRC as the US has pledged to provide Estonia with $140.5 million in Foreign Military Financing to strengthen Estonian security and defence.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Estonian Foreign Ministry has confronted the Chinese Foreign Ministry publicly by condemning a Chinese diplomat's question on Estonian sovereignty. The expulsion of diplomats between Estonia and PRC has also made it very unlikely to see Estonian diplomats or civil servants being trained by the PRC.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no identified citizen who has been detained in PRC or denied exit visas, and believed to be suffering from unfair legal treatments for political reasons, a.k.a. “hostage diplomacy”.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Estonia, as one of the 27 EU member states, is represented in the CCICED by the EU Commission's Director-General of Directorate-General Climate Action Kurt Vandenberghe
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: While Estonia has no agreement with the PRC regarding how their diplomatic relationship is classified, Estonia adopts the EU's committment to a 'comprehensive strategic partnership' with the PRC.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Estonian Foreign Ministry stated that it adheres to 'One China Policy' and showed its support for Taiwan to participate in interntional organisations, including but not limited to the World Health Organisation.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The EU and its Member States acknowledged the ruling of the South China Sea Arbitration (Permanent Court of Arbitration case number 2013-19). Therefore, Esotnia has rejected the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2022, Estonia has co-authored the UN Human Rights Council's draft resolution A/HRC/51/L.6 on 'Debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, China'. Therefore, Estonia has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2020, the government of Estonia signed on to a joint statement presented by Germany to the United Nations General Assembly that denounced the PRC’s treatment of citizens in Tibet, Xinjiang, and Hong Kong. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2021, Estonia joined 20 other countries in opposing the PRC’s imposition of the National Security Law on Hong Kong. Therefore, Estonia has denounced the PRC’s imposition of the National Security Law on Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Estonia's national university, the University of Tartu, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Huawei on supporting education, joint research and insfrastructure development. Therefore, this indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Tallinn University is the only Estonian university offering a Bachelor's Degree Program on Chinese Studies in Estonian language. Therefore, this indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Estonia and the PRC have renewed their agreement on education partnership for 2017-2022, and Chinese language is being taught in 10 general education schools. Therefore, this indicator deserves a 'Yes' response.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Estonian Foreign Policy Institute, University of Tartu and Tallinn University of Technology belong to the China-CEEC Think Tanks Network (中国中东欧国家智库交流与合作网络)
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Tallinn University has listed a number of scholarships provided by the PRC government for students to study in or research on the PRC.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Shanghai University of Finance and Economics (SUFE) funded nine Tallinn University's staff, including its Rector, for a visit during 30th October to 4th November to discuss cooperation between SUFE and Tallinn University.
evidence_urls: According internal documents of Tallinn University.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Yin Jie, member of Baltic Chinese Students and Scholars Association, was reported to harass Hong Kong students from Tartu University, Estonia's national university. Therefore, this indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Märt Lännemees, president of Estonian Academic Orientalist Society, was once denied entry to the PRC due to his advocacy for Tibet. Therefore this indicator desreves a 'Significant' rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Confucius Institute at Tallinn University does not involve in university curriculum design.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Some 70 Estonian intellectuals made a public address on PRC's influence activities in Estonia in 2021.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The identified sister-cities between Estonia and the PRC include three of the most populous Estonian cities, including Tallinn (Hangzhou and Chengdu), Tartu (Ningbo) and Narva (Xiamen). The 8th largest Estonian city Maardu's sister city is Changchun.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Yana Toom, Member of European Parliament and member of EU-Friendship Group, visited the PRC in 2016 paid by the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries. In 2019, she attended a China-CEEC roundtable in the PRC paid by the International Department of Central Committee of Communist Party of China.
Domestic Politics.note: https://the-president.europarl.europa.eu/home/ep-newsroom/pageContent-area/actualites/statement-on-the-ongoing-investigations-by-belgian-authorities.html All unofficial 'frienship' groups at the European Parliament are expected to be banned

Domestic Politics.evidence: The Estonian Member of European Parliament Yana Toom expressed sentiments on Chinese company Huawei in 2020; Mihhail Kõlvart, Tallinn's city mayor and chairman of Estonian Centre Party, expressed positive views on Chinese tourism market during a meeting with Chinese Minister of Culture and Tourism in 2019.
